meanings.definition: A person who has wrinkles, typically due to aging.
meanings.sent1: The kind wrinklie greeted us with a warm smile.
meanings.sent2: My grandmother is a sweet wrinklie who tells the best stories.
meanings.sent3: The wrinklie joked about needing a map to find their way back to their youth.
meanings.sent4: The wrinklie's face was a roadmap of a life well-lived.
meanings.sent5: The wrinklie's eyes sparkled with wisdom and kindness.

meanings.sent1: If you leave the paper out, it will wrinklie in no time.
meanings.sent2: Be careful not to wrinklie your clothes when packing them.
meanings.sent3: The heat caused the chocolate to wrinklie into a gooey mess.
meanings.sent4: Time seemed to wrinklie the once smooth surface of the leather.
meanings.sent5: The old book pages wrinklie with age, preserving their stories.

meanings.sent1: The wrinklie fabric felt soft and comforting.
meanings.sent2: She admired the wrinklie elephant's gentle eyes.
meanings.sent3: The wrinklie paper crinkled under her touch, revealing a hidden message.
meanings.sent4: The wrinklie bark of the tree told tales of many seasons.
meanings.sent5: The wrinklie smile on his face showed a lifetime of laughter.
